answers.answer: Hi!T2 MRI fat differentiate fat from water - but in this case fat shows darker, and water lighte than T1 MRI, and is good for diagnosing brain edema. The FLAIR technology suppress cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) effect and brings out the periventricular (ventricle is a cavity in brain filled with CSF) hyperintense lesions. These indicate small vessel ischemic disease or changes of brain blood vessels. These changes are seen in multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer's or Wilson's Disease, migraine headaches, diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol. Please discuss with your treating doctors. Take care!

question: Could you tell me what is hyperintense T2/flair signal changeThank
